overview:
Coach Grote was introduced to the competitive world of sports at an early age as he was a 3 sport athlete in both middle and high school. He attended Culver Summer Camps for 5 summers during his youth years where he competed in a multitude of sports, ranging from sailing to international soccer. His passion for sports eventually led him to a post-college hobby in competitive distance running. Since then, he has completed three marathons, ten half marathons, and four 200 mile relays, with several top 25 finishes.

During college, Myles leveraged his passion for sports and business to help build from ground-up, the Circle of Life Indiana University Mini Marathon, the first ever collegiate-hosted half marathon in the country. In its first year of operations, the 501(c)3 not-for-profit corporation generated revenue and gross profit of $192,000 and $60,000, respectively. Myles served as Chief Operating Officer for the corporation, managing day to day operations and a team of approximately 40 people.

Myles has had a history of quickly moving up within an organization as he has worked his way up to a management position at both Circle of Life and FactSet Research Systems, Inc., a leading provider of financial analytics software (NYSE: FDS). He currently manages a team of 17 consultants responsible for supporting over 563 clients from 64 financial institutions. He now serves as Co-Founder and Director of Finance for Bookacoach.com.

In addition to his management experience, he has been an avid investor since the early age of 16. Myles holds a B.S. degree in Business Finance from Indiana’s Kelley School of Business – Bloomington, IN.
